runs.comm: oopsy! This one skids very low! Good length ball pushed across him and that dribbles away to the keeper and beats Myburgh's surprised block
ducks in at him off a good length and he defends into the covers
no duck this time for Myburgh! Bit of width and he sends it to the point boundary with a rasping cut shot
fullish on off stump, he comes forward and drives to mid-off
looks to lash this through the covers and he doesn't mind hitting on the up. No timing though as Mills continues to probe just outside off
opens the face to beat a diving point. Good length ball just outside off sliced away
bounces just before McClenaghan at short fine leg. He's clutching his left hand after the ball struck him on the half-volley. Poor ball first up, straying down leg and it was flicked away
this time it's the right hander on strike and he bowls a lovely, fuller delivery that beats the outside edge
thumps on the up to short cover as he continues to attack the angle across him
digs it in and Swart is up to the challenge. Fetched it from outside off and swats it away to the midwicket boundary. No need to keep it down in the Powerplay
shifts back to teasing him outside off and Swart was lured into a lazy little dab to third man. Beaten

back of a length just outside off, Swart guides it towards point and he sets off. Tight single and Myburgh would have been out had Guptill's throw hit. He had only one stump to aim at, but he did have the benefit of some time to take aim
fullish on middle and leg, Swart pushes down to mid-on for a single
looking for that expansive drive again, but Mills' inswing refuses to give him any room. He has to settle with a push down the ground
goes full and outside off, Myburgh taps to mid-off
seeks the blockhole again, though this had a bit of width again. Myburgh threw his bat at it but only manages a thick bottom edge
picked away through midwicket as this is shortish and on the pads
walks at him and turns it into a low full toss, clipped to deep square leg
fullish delivery, pushing across him. Swart stayed put in his crease and hacks it down to mid-on
stand and deliver! This was a good length ball on off stump, and he has smashed it into the covers. Excellent work from Neesham though. Gets a hand to it and keeps it to two
full and swinging in at him as Boult raps him on the front foot. Myburgh was looking for midwicket, but was a little slow to counter the movement. Would have slid down leg

was that a catch?! No it clipped the back pad and burst through the keeper's gloves. This was another inswinger from Boult, pitching on a good length and drawing Myburgh into a hoist over the leg side. Doesn't connect because he was swinging across the line
shortish and around the fourth stump. Myburgh looks for a pull, but it sneaks beneath his bat, Bounces just before it goes to Ronchi
yorker on off stump, jams his bat down on it and pushes to mid-on
shortish and just outside off, but Myburgh is suckered by the lack in pace on this pitch. Looks for the cut way too early and gets it off the bottom edge
slashes at a full and wide delivery and gets a nick that goes down on the bounce to the keeper. Would have been a wide had he left it
a little fuller than he thought, but the primary mistake was him swinging across the line again. Thought that was a length ball he could get under, but it was a little fuller and just outisde off
slower ball on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
more change in pace as this is full and outside off, punched to mid-on. Still no runs off the over
completes the hat-trick, but this offcutter slides well down the leg side. Myburgh goes for a sweep, but can't hit it
off she goes over midwikcet! This he was able to get under and launched it into the relatively empty stands. Got his front leg on off stump as he picked it up off a length and whipped it away
fullish on and around off stump, defended down the pitch
that is wristwork at it's best! It was a fuller delivery on middle and Swart stays balanced and whipped it through midwicket. No fuss at all
and Boult retaliates immediately. Slides a good length ball across him and gets a little bit of nip away to beat the forward prod
a bit too straight there again and it's been nudged to deep midwicket

what a catch by Guptill! The short ball gets rid of the dangerous Myburgh! Goes for the pull, but ends up getting more of a top edge because it was a little too high for him to control. Possibly too quick too. Guptill had to run quite a distance to his left, tumbles over but clings on smartly
he's overstepped here! We're going to have our first free hit of the match. Swart stayed in line and nudged square on the leg side
clears his front and slaps a back of a length delivery into the cover field. Only a single
flights it on off stump, and he's driven into the off side
holds his length back and targets middle this timed, tucked away towards midwicket
set himself up for the sweep and Nath's lobbed a flighted ball outside off stump to allow him to find deep square leg
flat but full on off stump, defended down the pitch
bit more flight, but he refuses to afford any room. Barresi comes forward and picks it away to midwicket
shortish on middle and leg, Barresi pushes down to long-on
fullish and on the stumps, clipped away to deep square leg
back of a length on middle, Swart was looking for a quick single through midwicket. Hasn't placed it well enough
pushes down the ground and picks up a quick single after placing the ball between mid-off and mid-on. Well done by Swart

that's the nick and McClenaghan strikes early again! Barresi was on the back foot and wanted to steer this one just back of a good length down to third man. But the angled face proffers only an outside edge which safely rests inside Ronchi's gloves
fullish and pushed across him, he isn't interested in playing
draws him to poke outside his off stump, but short cover is on hand to keep it to nothing
comes down the track and drills a flighted delivery on off stump to long-on

this one goes on with the arm and Borren dabs into the off side and seeks a dangerous single. There was hesitation, there was sluggish running and there was also an awful fumble from Nathan at the bowler's end. Had he picked up the throw from Ronchi and clipped the bails, Borren would have been out
flighted and it doesn't turn again. Swart goes for the sweep, misses it completely. So does the keeper behind him

it's the captain who spills a chance this time! A very very tough one as he flings away to his right and goes one-handed to snag a well-hit flick. his fingertips control it for a couple of milliseconds before it pops out. Tries for a second attempt while he was still air-borne, but couldn't pull it off
flighted on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
whips wide of long-on as Nathan pushes it full and flat on off stump
hint of inswing drives this good length ball down the leg side
fullish, and it's cross-seamed. Borren strides forward and caresses it down the ground to the long-off boundary
beaten outside off as McClenaghan hits a good length and gets the ball to angle away
Borren presents an angled bat to the fullish ball outside off. Doesn't beat point
good length ball on middle, Borren tucks it away towards midwicket
worked away between midwicket and long-on. Nicely done as he planted his front foot on off stump and played a calculated flick

140kph, indulges in a short ball which has been dispatched to the square leg boundary. He was trying to outsmart Swart who was pushing on the front foot, but it didn't matter for the batsman who adjusted and whacked it away
shortish delivery, skids underneath the bat as he was trying to pull. Ronchi does well behind the stumps
skips down the track and gets to the pitch and he hits with the turn to beat long-on. Excellent shot from the Netherlands captain. Going forward is the way against spin here
dropped but this was drilled! Strikes him on the right hand, just on the right palm. Borren had danced down and smacked a flighted ball back at the bowler and it was coming around neck height for him
flighted on middle and off, he's clipped to midwicket
dances down the track and chips it over the bowler to long-on
worked away between midwicket and long-on
presents a half-volley with loads of width this time. Borren sets himself up on the front foot and a full swing of the arms sends the ball crashing to long-off boundary
slog to deep square leg and Mills was sluggish to start hunting it down. Invests in a clumsy dive but he's nowhere near the ball. Lenght from Anderson again allows Borren to slog sweep
width outside off and Borren's slashed into the covers

this was a low full toss outside off, and Borren bunts it into the midwicket region. Anderson is close enough and runs around to intercept it and had he thrown down the stumps at the bowler's end, Borren would've been out
worked away through midwicket for an easy single
back of a length delivery, was slower too. He adjusts for the lack of pace and defends. Swart was looking for a single again. Had to rush back

as simple as that. Swart was looking to follow his captain's example from the last over, but Nathan's slipped in the straighter one and pulled his length back. He was dancing down the track and making room to combat the offspinner. The slash can't connect and Ronchi does the rest
turned away just in front of square as this is a good length ball on middle and off
worked away just to the right of midwicket
well flighted on middle, Cooper clears his legs and digs it out
comes forward and pushes the fuller delivery back to the bowler

reverse sweep goes fine. Mills has given up the chase. This was tossed up on off stump, and he's got into a pretty decent position to swing it away and place it well away from the fielder inside the circle
back of a length and outside off, dabbed to point
full length ball offers a little bit of room for Borren to get under. Lifts it over cover to rotate strike
taps the good length ball outside off into the covers
length ball around forth or fifth stump, Corren was looking for the slog over cow corner and misses
goes fuller and straighter this time and the ball darts off Borren's pads towards long leg
carved away to deep third man as he stays on the back foot and back cuts this shortish ball outside off
starts off with a good length ball on leg stump, Cooper stands up tall and pushes down the ground
what a strike! Calm as anything, Borren strides down the track and has walloped this over long-on. Williamson flights one a little too much and he's paid for it
walks way across outside off and he's pulled the shortish ball towards long leg. McClenaghan races forward to try and catch it, but it falls well short
he'd seen there to be very little turn on offer and sets himself up for the straighter ball. Dabs it almost off the keeper's gloves and enjoys a clever boundary
races down the pitch to clip the flighted ball on leg stump to midwicket. Falls short of the captain

Boult and one-handers! You never bet against that combo, but this time he isn't able to pull it off. Goes for the slog sweep and he got a little too much height on it. Did bisect the two men in the deep and though Boult ran back quickly, he wasn't able to make enough ground
walks across to off stump and drills the fuller ball on off stump to long-off
slower, length ball. Cooper was looking for a slog over midwicket but misses. Ball thuds onto thigh pad. Cooper calls him through for a single as the ball wanders away towards point
offcutter ends up a length ball on off stump, he picks it away and finds a boundary to the right of square leg
another length ball and it's been smashed over long-on. That short leg side boundary is luring the Netherlands batsmen and McClenaghan is obliging with the wrong length
fullish and angled in on off stump, drills it down to mid-on
full and just outside off, he thumps it into the covers off the front foot
slower ball on leg stump, worked away to deep square leg
waits for this back of a length delivery and guides if off the open face towards third man
the batsman was walking at him, prompting Neesham to go short. But along with the change of length he offered way too much room. Cut away behind point
change of pace helps draw a bit of a mistake as the batsman gets a leading edge which clears the bowler
this is the slower ball off the back of the hand and Borren was charging down the track and the heave doesn't connect
picks this length ball off leg stump and flicks it towards deep square leg. It spun the wrong way after pitching, but the fielder does extremely well to adjust
Borren has no trouble handling his pace, so much that he goes down on one knee and sweeps him down to the long leg boundary.
full and just outside off, Borren was going for the slog over midwicket. Doesn't time it well enough
it's the offcutter which ends up a half-volley, Cooper is forward and smokes it down the ground. Clean strike
persists with the same ball, but he pulls his length back. Bit of low bounce allows the ball to sneak under the slog to midwicket
thick inside edge skews off towards long leg. This was a little too full to pull but he gets away with it
he's shoveled it straight into the hands of point! No fifty for the captain. This was full and wide from Mills and he dabs at it with the angled bat and picks out Williamson
backs away to open up the off side, but Neesh follows him with a back of the hand slower ball. Defended into the off side
this is seam up and dug in short as he watches the batsman make room. Ben thinks it would be a wide and lets it alone, but he had backed away too far
full and wide outside off, he goes for a cover drive but can't connect
another one pushed well outside off stump, Ben searches for runs square on the off side. Very close to that wide line
another full and wide delivery. Ben lunges to it slash it through the off side, but it's way too wide to connect. Think that's another one he's got away with
walks acorss to the off side to try and reach those balls angled across him, but this time Neesh slides this down the leg side and the ump reckons it's fine. Just one run off the over
good length ball on off stump, Tom walks across and swipes it away to deep midwikcet
full and swinging in at him, Ben was shuffling across to whip it away to midwicket but ends up inside edging onto pad. Sneak a single in front of point
misses the yorker as this ends up a half-volley outside off and Tom's slashed this through point. Excelllent shot and he picks the gap perfectly
full and outside off, pushed wider as he sees Tom moving well outside off stump. Looking to scoop this to long leg. Doesn't get under it and it squirts to third man off his boot
walks across again and Boult fires in the outside off stump yorker. Continues playing the scoop and continues not connecting
whipped away between midwicket and mid-on for a single. Excellent lengths from Boult again as this is really full on middle
